channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [OOZIE-1481] Getting a coordinator job info with len=0 should return 0 actions
item.description:
If you fetch a URL such as:

http://localhost:11000/oozie/v1/job/0000002-130731172618471-oozie-oozi-C?len=1

you'll get the job info for the coordinator job, and 1 of its actions.

If you only want to get the info for the coordinator job itself and don't care about the actions, it seems logical that len=0 should do this; however, it seems to be ignored and gives you all actions instead. 

http://localhost:11000/oozie/v1/job/0000002-130731172618471-oozie-oozi-C?len=0

should return 0 actions.
item.summary: Getting a coordinator job info with len=0 should return 0 actions

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: len specifies how many coord actions to return; by saying len=0 you would be asking for Oozie to return 0 coord actions. It would be useful if you just want the Coord job info but no action info.
I thought Ryota already did this, when he was doing pagination for coord actions. egashira, isn't that the case?

oozie-console.js:
url: getOozieBase() + 'job/' + coordJobId + "?timezone=" + getTimeZone() + "&offset=0&len=0"

It is already done. Robert, can you check and close this if it works for you?
yes, should be fixed in OOZIE-1357.

Using the latest trunk, I ran the Aggregator example that creates 2 actions:

Notice the number of entries in the actions in each output. When len=2, it was 2; when len=1 it was 1; and when len=0 it was 2 again.
Robert, thx for details. let me check and get back.

V1JobServlet:

int len = (lenStr != null) ? Integer.parseInt(lenStr) : 0;
len = (len < 1) ? defaultLen : len;

should be len < 0. But also need to change OozieCLI to not pass 0 by default.
